before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"2q1av","text":"Make sure all chemicals are available in their right concentrations needed to make the 10x PCR buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description:
{"blocks":[{"key":"4gcdt","text":"10X ThermoPol Reaction Buffer is optimized for use with Vent® and Deep Vent® DNA Polymerases. This buffer also provides superior reaction conditions for other thermophilic DNA polymerases, includingTaqDNA Polymerase, OpenVent as well as various other DNA and RNA modifying enzymes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":198,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2jasq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egcaf","text":"Here we describe the protocol used in making a 10x PCR buffer recipe that provides optimum reaction condition for OpenVent polymerase enzyme. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c9ls","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32ugr","text":"10x PCR buffer comprise of:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8serm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qdi6","text":"100 mM KCL
100 mM (NH)2SO4
200 mM Tris-HCL pH8.8 @ 25c
20 mM MgSO4
1 % Triton x100","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":65,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ifn9","text":"This protocol describes the steps in preparing a low cost 10x PCR buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: 10x PCR buffer recipe, Composition of 10x PCR buffer

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"durt1","text":"Before preparing the 10x PCR buffer, prepare 1M and initial stocks of the different chemicals that would be used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48k4g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ac0j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dd2qu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c225q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3jk6p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cuc0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0tis","text":"Prepare 10 mL of 1 M concentration of each of the chemical stocks by weighing the salt powders as indicated in the table 1 below:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":129}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fla1v","text":"Weigh out the salts as indicated in the table and add to a 100 mL glass beaker.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ei43o","text":"Measure out 10 mL of distilled water and add to the glass beaker.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fn3a","text":"Add a magnetic flea and place on a magnetic stirring plate to mix the solution as shown in figure 1","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36i3h","text":"To sterilize, autoclave the solutions by using a steam autoclave at 121° C for at least 30 minutes under at least 15 psi. (All the solutions should be transferred into Duran bottles that can withstand heating).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":122,"length":88}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93m7r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2nve","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fee56","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7cmbh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17sri","text":"To make 1M Tris HCL pH 8.8","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8kc8k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1v7ui","text":"Weigh out   Tris and add to a 50 mL glass beaker.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":10,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8gpp9","text":"Measure out 8 mL of distilled water and add to the glass beaker.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqb5n","text":"Add a magnetic flea and place on a magnetic stirring plate to mix the solution as shown in figure 1.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"av32t","text":"Add a pH meter into the solution to observe the pH.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"884hk","text":"Slowly add the 3 M hydrochloric acid (HCl) solution using a Pasteur pipette to reduce the pH to  . Be careful not to add too much at a time, since the pH will change rapidly.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":96,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ls6c","text":"Once the desired pH has been reached, top up the solution to 10 mL using distilled water.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1l8jc","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3uu9i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d32k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"blen3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ddbt5","text":"We adopt 3 M stock of HCL to use in preparing Tris-HCL","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7aiti","text":"Prepare 10 mL of 3 M HCL  by diluting 3.129 mL of concentrated or 37% HCL in 6.871 mL of distilled water.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":18,"offset":65,"style":"bold"}],"key":"6vo53","text":"When you mix acid with water, it's extremely important to add the acid to the water rather than the other way around. This is because acid and water react in a vigorous exothermic reaction, releasing heat, sometimes boiling the liquid.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["Chemical ","Amount needed in (g) for 1 M stock"],["Tris","1.211"],["KCL","0.74"],["NH(SO4)2","1.30"],["MgSO4","1.20"]],"guid":"5845695001D111ED9A679D29633D4F62","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8fdt7","text":"Table 1","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Chemical ","Amount needed in (g) for 1 M stock"],["Tris","1.211"],["KCL","0.74"],["NH(SO4)2","1.30"],["MgSO4","1.20"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.211","error":false,"guid":"D5152B700CE211ED9EE96155D5EF4482","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"4":{"type":"ph","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"105AA2200CE611ED92EDE5171AD9C816","id":0,"number":"8.8"}},"5":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"18B419D00CDF11ED9EE96155D5EF4482","height":196.24363636363654,"id":274441,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8r57","text":"Figure 1","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"IMG_3658.JPG","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inambq77x.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inajbq77x.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inakbq77x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inaibq77x.webp","width":259.45673076923106}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4uk2r","text":"Pipette the following reagent stocks into a clean 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube as described in the table below to compose 1 mL of 10x PCR buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cl28l","text":"1M KCL

title: Preparing 10x PCR buffer
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"9khp3","text":"HCL is very corrosive and should be handled with care.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7v8ep","text":"Wear protective clothing (Lab coat), face masks and gloves.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
